result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Sevcik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No contact with Jay Adrienssens and/or his family members, his residence or place of employment.
No contact with Jordan Drolshagen.

Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CF29. 
Write a letter of apology within the next 60 days. 
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment, education and any counseling that he may be involved in. 
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment tool. 
Sentence to commence within the next 60 days. 
Must make arrangements thru the Department and the Jail.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:26 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 14CF29, 14CF39, 14CF116
Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Drengler states one correction to the charges. 
Atty Knaapen states additional correction. 
Parties agree there will be no charge which requires the defendant to register as a sex offender. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF29 Count 4 - 
6 months jail, STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years. 
Undergo a mental health assessment and comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.
Go to school fulltime, work fulltime or combination to equal fulltime. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate.
No contact with the juveniles:
B.S. 6/3/96
S.A.K. 7/19/99 
S.A.K. 7/19/99
B.L.R. 1/3/97
B.A.P. 2/24/98
Write letters of apology to those victims within the first 60 days of probation. 
No unsupervised contact with minors with the exception of family members while on supervision. 
Required to have a psycho-sexual evaluation and comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.  
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

14CF39 Count 1 - 
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years concurrent with 14CF29: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CF29. 
No contact with Jay Adriaenssens and/or his family members, his residence or place of employment.
No contact with Jordan Drolshagen. 
Write a letter of apology with the next 60 days. 
Pay restitution of $298.24. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Serve 150 days jail. 
Huber for employment, education and any counseling that he may be involved in. 
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment tool. 
Sentence to commence within the next 60 days. 
Must make arrangements thru the Department and the Jail. 

14CF39 Count 2 - 
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 150 days jail, concurrent with Count 1. 
Huber for employment, education and any counseling that he may be involved in. 
Allowed to serve the entire sentence on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK assessment tool. 
Sentence to commence within the next 60 days. 
Must make arrangements thru the Department and the Jail. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements re: the no contact provision. 
State files restitution form. 
Court questions restitution. 

14CF116 Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent with all other cases: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in all other cases. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Court finds society will not be harmed and grants expungment under 973.015 on all 3 cases.  

Parties address jail credit. 
Parties to review and prepare a stipulation and order. 
If there is any credit on the cases with 150 days jail, credit can be used against those 150 days. 

Parties retain copies of the PSI in their files confidentially. 
Court advises of post-conviction.
Sentencing hearing at 11-24-2015 02:15 pm
Sentencing hearing at 10-16-2015 08:30 am
Sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF29, 14CF39, 14CF116

11:03 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

14CF29 Count 4 - NO CONTEST
14CF39 Counts 1 & 2- NO CONTEST
14CF116 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF29 Count 4, 14CF39 Counts 1 & 2, 14CF116 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF29 Counts 1 thru 3, 14CF39 Counts 3 thru 11 and 14CF116 Counts 2 & 3, 14CM60 are dismissed and read-in. 

Bond and the conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 07-13-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF29, 14CF39, 14CF116

11:45 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Court will be rescheduling this matter due to lack of time.  
Court questions Atty Knaapen re: victim statements. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

BY THE COURT:  Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
from ADA re: plea agreement
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:13 pm. Court calls case.
Court states appearances.
Motion to Declare Sec. 301.45(1m), Stats Unconstitutional As Applied to Sevcik.
Atty Knaapen gives brief reply.
Atty Knaapen cites case law.
Atty Drengler gives a brief response.
Court gives statements.
Court cites statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Motion denied. Statute not found unconstitutional.

Court makes statements on plea being withdrawn.

Court indicates defendant withdrew his plea on one of the files.
Atty Knaapen makes statement as to charges that were dismissed and read in be re-opened and reinstituted.
Pleas accepted, convictions stated on the record that the State wants reinstituted.
State indicates that in 14CF116 - cts 2 & 3 should be reinstated, 14CF60 - charge be reinstated, 14CF29 - because plea was withdrawn, cts 2-4 should be reinstated.
Atty Drengler responds. Defense believes all pleas should be withdrawn.
Atty Knaapen does not agree to withdrawing previous pleas.
Court indicates there needs to be an individual analysis on the other pleas. Issue is not before the Court and therefore will not be addressed.
Court indicates this matter needs to be set for pre-trial for negotiations, if no resolution then briefs need to be filed.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on February 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF39, 14CF29, 14CF116

Atty Drengler moves to adjourn the hearing at this time.
Atty Knaapen makes statements re: plea agreement.  Asks to reinstate all charges. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments.   Asks for more time and the request in writing. 

BY THE COURT: 
State is to put in writing their request that all charges be re-instated. 
If defense objects, they can respond in writing as well. 

Atty Drengler anticipates to file his motion by the end of next week. 
Court advises the original is to be sent to the clerk with copies to the Judge and DA. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on December 11, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
(Cases following 14CF-29 are 14CF-39 and 14CF-116)

11:16 AM Court calls case and states appearances.

Defendant wishes to withdraw his plea on 14CF-29 case due to the fact of not being aware of having to file as a sex offender.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, this matter should proceed, for reasons stated on the record.

Victims were given notification of today's proceedings.

BY THE COURT:
Court will allow the Defendant to withdraw his plea and matter will be scheduled for a trial.

A sentencing hearing will be scheduled on the other two cases,  14CF-39 and 14CF-116.
A PSI has been prepared already.

State addresses the Court regarding plea agreement covering all three cases. State may not be bound to the agreement made on 14CF-39 and 14CF-116, because the agreement was made upon premise of all three cases.

Atty Drengler has another motion to file.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on October 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF29, 14CF39, 14CF116

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Drengler states corrections to the PSI.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  No victims are present. 
Atty Drengler requests a hearing regarding the Sex Offender Reporting requirements.  Moves to withdraw the guilty pleas on ineffective assistance of counsel. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler advises the statute is 301.45(1m).
Court reviews. 
Court questions Atty Knaapen. 
Court questions Atty Drengler further. 

Court questions Ms. Graebl, PSI writer. 

Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler moves to withdraw the plea on the 14CF29.
Court advises Atty Drengler to provide that in writing.  Court will schedule it for a hearing.

Court addresses the defendant. 
BY THE COURT: Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CF-29, 14CF-39 and 14CF-116.

8:36 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.
Matters are scheduled for a sentencing hearing today.
Court did order a PSI, copies were forwarded to counsel.
Atty Knaapen has no corrections from a factual standpoint. Defense will be asking that the sentencing hearing be rescheduled.

There was a request by the Department because of the number of PSIs they were preparing that they would be given more time. Court did grant them more time, until the 22nd. Atty Drengler states that his office received the PSI on the 23rd and received it in his hands on the 24th.

Court clearly has to grant the request, cannot go forward without the opportunity.
The department is very busy with preparing PSI's, they have a heavy caseload.

Parties continue discussions regarding dates to reschedule.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Requesting PSI extension - Granted.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon R. Sevcik in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF29, 14CF39, 14CF116. and 14CM60 for plea hearing today. 
 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
14CF29 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 3 yr Probation: Mental Assessment and comply with any counseling or treatment. Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Pay costs. Apology letters to victims.  No contact with B.L.R., E.M.B., S.A.K. and B.S.  No unsupervised contact with minors, exception of family members.  No expungement option.  Counts 2, 3, & 4 to be DRI. 
14CF39 Ct 1 & 2: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation: Same conditions as 14CF29. Pay costs & No DNA surcharge for each count. No expungement option.  Counts 3 thru 11 to be DRI.
14CF116 Ct 1: W/H Sentence: 36 mo Probation: Same conditions as 14CF29. Pay costs with DNA surcharge. No expungement option.  Counts 2 & 3 to be DRI
14CM60 to be DRI.
PSI report is requested.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 No Contest to 14CF29 Ct 1, 14CF39 Ct 1 & 2,  and 14CF116 Ct 1
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF29 Ct 1, 14CF39 Ct 1 & 2,  and 14CF116 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.  14CF29 cts 2, 3, & 4, 14CF39 3 thru 11, 14CF116 cts 2 & 3, and 14CM60 are Dismissed and Read In.

Court Orders PSI Report.  Copies due to parties by 09-05-14.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.
